title: Great coffee
text: I’m not into the specialty drinks but I do get a cappuccino once in a while just for a little change and everything is always good. Costa Rica coffee is Way better than wawa

title: Excellent Polish dishes
text: It’s a small place but the food was really good and the prices are very reasonable. I had their pork special and the sourkraut soup and on a cold winter evening it really hit the spot. We will definitely be back for more.

title: Another hard rock
text: We visit them all wherever we are and they are at least consistent so if you’re just arriving in a city and are unsure for your first meal this is always a good option since you can at least try the local beers here if not the local cuisine.

title: Nice site
text: Not really much standing at this site but you can get the general idea of the layout and the location of the buildings. If you have any interest in the apostle Paul than this is where it’s reported that he preached so there are usually a few Christian tours reading the gospel as your walking around. Museum is small but some nice Roman artifacts and a really nice Greek helmet.

title: Must see the charioteer
text: The life like face of the charioteer must be seen to be believed. One of the truly great works of art is housed in this museum. A must see!

title: Tremendous location
text: What a view! Both the ride to the site and once you climb up through the site there are tremendous views of the valley below. The site itself is obviously only a shadow of its former glory but you can tell from what remains that it was a great and sacred site for the ancient Greeks. The navel of the world is there and it is an ‘outie’ not an ‘inie’.

title: You will feel like a king
text: Standing at the top of this hill looking down at the valley below, you will feel like a king. It is no wonder that Agamemnon felt so powerful and launched the war on Troy from here. The architecture is amazing and the site is well preserved. I was particularly impressed with the beehive tombs of Clytemnestra and Agamemnon.

title: One of the top five in Greece
text: This was one of my top five things that I saw in Greece. I was so impressed by the construction of this theatre. Our tour guide had us climb to the top of this 15,000 seat theatre and she dropped a coin and ripped a piece of paper on the stage and we could hear it just as clearly as if we were in the front row. Amazing! We didn’t have time to visit the other areas at this site so I can’t comment on them.

title: Interesting tour
text: Very interesting tour even when it’s the off season and nothing much is happening in the processing plant because the slide show that they present gives you a good understanding of how the olive oil is made. They also gave us a nice snack to taste the olive oil and now I know to look for the date and how important it is.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Really nice hotel. We really couldn’t get over how beautiful the hotel was with beautiful stone work throughout, large spacious rooms, big pool and great selection of food for both breakfast and dinner. The beach was more pebbles than sand but the water was warm and since this was the first time swimming in the Mediterranean I was amazed at how buoyant I was.

title: Interesting and good views
text: Nice relaxing boat ride to the island and great views from the fortress. Interesting history of the place and to realize that not very long ago it was a leper colony. Well worth the trip to hear how indomitable the spirit of man can be.

title: Cool statue
text: Not sure why I liked this but I just thought it was great that a city today would spend money on a large statue. Everyone seems to want to get close and grab its feet so you have to get a picture of yourself doing it.

title: Great octopus
text: Really great octopus and calamari with a nice setting by the lake to just watch people and drink wine. There are lots of places like this and the restaurant on the other side of the lake suggested this one when we said we wanted calamari and they didn’t serve it.

title: Nice tour
text: Nice tour and interesting to find out that the grape vines are grown in a circle like a birds nest because it’s so windy on Santorini that they just couldn’t stay up. Wine is nice but I only liked the one desert wine, vinsanto.

title: Crowd is overwhelming
text: If you can see the view, it’s great but the crowds are just way too much for me. I would never go back.

title: Completely covered archeological site
text: The only completely covered archeological site that I have ever seen which makes it very pleasant to walk around and visit. Must be seen with a guide because the few signs don’t give you the full story and you need someone to explain things. You wouldn’t think that this was the basis for the lost city of Atlantis until you visit the museum in Fira and see the wonderful items that were found here.

title: Must see the monkeys
text: The best pieces from Akrotiri are housed here and you have to see the wall paintings of the monkeys and the little gold ibis. These were the reason for this being considered the lost city of Atlantis. Just extraordinary!

title: Excellent view and food
text: Really nice restaurant in Fira to sit and watch the ship activity in the caldera. Calamari and wine was excellent os what more can you ask for.

title: Food ok, view terrific
text: Food was just ok but the view was terrific and they have donkey beer so it was nice to just get a snack and drink donkey beer while viewing the caldera.

title: Quiet and lots of stairs
text: Nice hotel. Clean comfortable rooms and a really nice view from the pool but lots of stairs. Seems like there must be four or five levels and to get anywhere you’re always going up or down stairs with no elevator. But I would stay here again because it’s within easy walking of Fira. Food however was mediocre, especially the buffet in the evening.

title: One of the truly great archeological sites
text: One of the truly great archeological sites of the world. The Minoan culture was exceptional and the site gives you some idea of what this civilization contributed to the western world. The finest pieces have been removed from the site to the Heraklion Archaeological Museum but the site is still worth seeing.

title: Nice place to hang out
text: Good place to just hang out and use as a meeting point when walking around the shopping area. Everyone knows where it is so you can use it to regather if you separate from your traveling companions.

title: Nice old fort
text: Nice old fort to walk around and get nice views of the city, harbor and port from the top of the walls.

title: World class
text: All of the major archeological finds from the palace of Knossos are housed in this museum. The Minoan civilization was extraordinary and the presentation of the pieces in this museum will convince you how extraordinary they were.

title: This is a must
text: If in Heraklion you have to have bougatsa at this place and watch all of the tourists taking pictures of the lion fountain across the square.

title: Very good location
text: Good location in the city and very clean and modern. Close to the port for getting the ferry and close to the museum and shopping areas. Breakfast was good not great, not a big selection but nothing to really complain about either.

title: Nice to eat under the trees
text: Just a nice outdoor restaurant with great food and pleasant staff. Everything was really nice and just a joy to sit and have a nice dinner.

title: World class museum
text: This is where you will find the greatest treasures of Greece. They’ve collected the best of the Greek archaeology treasures into this museum so it’s the best of the best from all over Greece. Can’t go wrong by going here.

title: Unique decor
text: Unique decor with cushioned sofas outside and old fashioned lamps but the food was good as well. Lots of locals eating there los you know it’s going to be nice.

title: Beautiful view
text: Beautiful view of the acropolis and the food is good as well. Breakfast in particular is really nice to have outside.

title: Marvelous
text: Can be seen from almost anywhere in the city but up close you have to be amazed at the size and beauty. Always crowded and often windy it’s still a must to see up close and to marvel at it being 2500heards old.

title: Just a marvel
text: This has to be seen to be appreciated. Get there early to avoid the largest crowds but it is never really empty. Should be seen with a tour guide to understand the intricacies of its construction and its history.

title: Superior museum
text: All of the original pieces from the acropolis are housed in this museum so it’s just marvelous. The design is such that there is an exact replica of the Parthenon with the original pieces in the museum and a huge window behind you so that you can turn around and see the Parthenon - just a marvelous way to preserve the originals and put it into perspective.

title: Nice hotel and good location
text: Really nice hotel with a great location because you can walk to so many places..including Ermou street, Syntagma square, the agora etc but far enough away from too much traffic and noise. It also has a really friendly staff and the breakfast is also good with a great view of the acropolis.

title: Always a delay when I fly United.
text: Every time I fly United there seems to be some kind of delay. This time is was an equipment delay so we left about 90 minutes late. I really prefer that they find equipment problems on the ground but why is it always at the last minute. And of course who could possibly not mention the leg room (or lack there of) whenever an airline review is done.

title: Nice break from the beach
text: Nice break from the beach but it’s not very big. Half of the animals and plants are non native. Birds from Australia, trees from Guatemala etc and they don’t seem to care that invasive species cause real harm if they get out of their cages or botanical gardens. Not a very eco friendly island.

title: Sales people are pushy
text: In every story sales people follow you around like an attached tail. Very annoying. Everything is half price which means that nothing is a bargain.

title: Excellent food and drink
text: We accomplished our mission. My wife and I needed to warm our old bones, get some vitamin D and eat/drink well. All of which we completed at this resort for an entire week. The weather was excellent which was our main focus - because when we left home it was 8 degrees and when we landed it was 80. The sun shone every day with only a drizzle one evening and all of the food was really good. The liquor was all name brands, the bars were within easy reach and the in room refrigerator was refreshed twice a day. No matter how they made their chicken it was always moist, the deserts were excellent and the lobster tails Friday night at the eight rivers restaurant were large and done just right. The only area which needed improvement was the entertainment. It’s not that the singers weren’t good and we really enjoyed the steel drum band. It’s just that it was pretty much the same every night. I know it’s a Caribbean island what do I expect but we’ve been to other islands and they do try to vary it a little. Tip, don’t do the shopping trip off the resort. Everyone just trying to rip you off. This is not a resort problem, just an island problem.

title: Good but a little pricey
text: While I can’t say that anything we had was bad. I also can’t say that anything was great. We went for a birthday celebration and the food was good with a nice selection for everyone but no one was blown away by anything and the one complaint that everyone had was that it was really loud. So if you’re looking for a quiet romantic dinner this is not the place. I would go back, just with slightly less expectations. I quess I was expecting gourmet and was a little disappointed but not enough to totally disregard the place.

title: A must do for a lobster roll
text:
So this is the six phases you go through at Red’s
1. Ok the line isn’t that long
2. WOW 20 minuets and we haven’t really moved
3. Martha Steward and Robert Redford ate here. I bet they didn’t wait in line
4. $24.95 that’s outrageous. I should have left 45 minuets ago.
5. If they had two windows it would move faster
6. WOW this is huge. I can’t eat it all. This is Great. I’m always coming back here.

title: Decent pizza
text: I’m spoiled by living in an area that has some of the best pizza in the country but this place was certainly acceptable and the price can’t be beat.

title: Good bar food
text: Nothing fancy at this bar/restaurant but what we ordered was tasty and done right. The outside seating on the balcony was nice as long as you down sit in the sun.

title: Good and reasonably priced
text: Good food and not that expensive. The clam chowder was especially good on a cool September day. Not a big selection of beers but what they had went down easy.

title: Nice hike
text: Not exactly easy but the view was certainly worth it. We didn’t do the harder Indian trail but it was still very steep and I wouldn’t want to do it on a rainy day.

title: Quiet and relaxing
text:
The whole setting of the Lodge is relaxing. The owners are available when needed but out of site when not. The decor is totally Maine with that hunting lodge ambiance. Moose decorations were the theme of our ‘moose’ room and the whirlpool tub was a big hit after hiking.
I’d also recommend having dinner at the Lodge if you’re there when it’s being served. It was really great!

title: Convenient and clean
text: Overall I would stay at this hotel again because it is convenient to the friends and relatives that I visit in Portland. However, I have to complain about the loud air conditioner in the room which is either making the room really cold and loud or off. I also don’t appreciate Fox News constantly playing on the main hallway tv. But the room was large, clean and comfortable so for the price in Portland it’s acceptable.

title: Really close to the park entrance
text: Small hotel with clean rooms and close to the Manuel Antonio Park entrance. I'd come back to this hotel since it's just far enough away form the beach and park entrance to not have the commotion but just an easy walk to restaurants and shops. The breakfast was really good and the free sangria and snacks at happy hour was a nice touch. The only complaint I had was the door to the room. It's a sliding door and the lock was a slight pain to lock.

title: Very popular park
text: It's sort of amazing that there are as many animals to see in this park considering how many people are walking around. I was disappointed that I could not leave and come back in the same day without paying again. We did see sloths, toucans, howler monkeys, squirrel monkeys, capuchin monkeys and some really cool lizards and birds. It's best to go once in the morning with a guide and then another day do a late afternoon hike on your own to the back trails. It closes at 4pm so that's also not convenient. All in all it's a must to do.

title: Good calamari and red snapper but weak mojito
text: Really large portions of food and the red snapper, shrimp and calamari were excellent but the drinks were really weak and a little pricey.
place: Restaurante and Sports Bar El Sol

title: Ate here multiple times
text: Great fish tacos and sangria with really large portions. We ate here twice for dinner because it was so good

title: More relaxing than by the beach
text: Really good quesadilla and sangria with large portions. The atmosphere seemed just a little more relaxed than many of the restaurants. You can still sit and watch the people going to the park but it was nice and cool and relaxed.

title: Nice sand and perfect water temp
text: The beach is great. Semi crowded but still easy to find a nice spot and the water temperature is just right- not too hot and not cold.

title: Lots of great samples
text: I like informative tours and this fit the bill. Learned all about how to process coffee beans and how long it takes to get me my jolt in the morning. Also got some great samples of sugar cane juice, coco butter, coffee of course and corn puffs.

title: Good for one night before flight
text: I wouldn't want to stay anymore than one night in this motel. We stayed one night and left our car there when we flew out of Philly. It was clean, quiet and the van arrived when we needed it but it wasn't close to anything but the airport.
place: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Philadelphia Airport

title: Great for Lunch
text: We ate here twice and each time the food and drinks were great. A huge selection soI would have gone back to try even more. Excellent crepes, watermelon juice and makiccino.

title: Better after dark
text: They let you visit during the day and then come back at night for free-they even provide a flashlight. During the day some of the frogs are out and at night others so since we were staying just up the road we visited twice. Excellent selection of frogs. Since many are really small and camouflaged it's hard to see them in the wild so this really was the only way to see some of them. Good for kids and curious adults.

title: Not a big fan of snakes
text: While I'm not a big fan of snakes, this was still interesting to me to see the scary stuff that might be lurking under the bushes, without getting to close to the glass. Good selection of both venomous and non-venomous snakes along with some turtles and lizards.

title: Really nice learning experience for adults and kids
text: They start out with a lecture about geological periods and show the advantages for animals to go through different stages of metamorphosis. Besides butterflies they also talk about scorpions and other indigenous bugs so it's really well done. The butterfly gardens contain some really pretty ones and it's easy to get some good photos.

title: Incredible smells
text: Lots of orchids, obviously not all bloom at the same time but the variety was astounding in such a relatively small garden. I really never knew orchids could have so many different smells. Everything from tutti-frutti to Chanel no5 to orange and even blood.

title: Peaceful and educational for adults and kids
text: They start out with a lecture about geological periods and show the advantages for animals to go through different stages of metamorphosis. Besides butterflies they also talk about scorpions and other indigenous bugs so it's really well done. The butterfly gardens contain some really pretty ones and it's easy to get some good photos.
